intro: Leptorkis wageneri, commonly known as the African sand thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and clustered in a rounded head. Leptorkis wageneri is often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
